Help: Content Negotiation

Content Negotiation selectors are used by the application to determine the representation to use in the response based on the Accept header sent by the client.

Selectors are named, and within your REST and RPC services, you will select from these names to indicate which representations you will support.

Each selector consists of maps of Zend Framework 2 View Models and the Accept mimetypes that, when matched, will cause the given View Model to be used.

Note: For this Content Negotiation to work in your RPC services, you will need to always return a ZF\ContentNegotiation\ViewModel.
